thread.title: Greek unemployment steady at 25%
thread.title_full: Greek unemployment steady at 25% | Business Spectator

author: Dow Jones newswires
title: Greek unemployment steady at 25%
text:
Greek unemployment remained stable in July, figures released by the national statistics agency showed on Thursday, but remained at record high levels, more than double the average of the eurozone and European Union.
Greece's seasonally adjusted jobless rate in July was 25 per cent, equal to June's downwardly revised 25 per cent and down from 26.3 per cent in July 2014, the Hellenic Statistics Service, or Elstat, said.
During the same period, the eurozone's average was 10.9 per cent and the EU's 9.5 per cent.
According to a draft budget submitted to the Greek parliament earlier this week, unemployment is expected to inch higher next year to 25.8 per cent from 25.4 per cent in 2015.
In absolute terms, some 1.2 million Greeks are without jobs, with the inactive population -- those who aren't in employment or searching for a job -- amounting to 3.3 million.
The younger members of the country's workforce are worst hit by the poor labor market conditions, with 48.6 per cent of those aged between 15 to 24 looking for work, the data showed.
The jobless rate hit a record high of 27.9 per cent in September 2013.
